name: Mazza v. Kensington Water Company et al., Appellants

judges: Before Kephart, O. J., Schaefer, Maxey, Linn, Stern and Barnes, JJ.
parties: Mazza v. Kensington Water Company et al., Appellants.

opinions.text:
Per Curiam,
The six Judges who heard the re-argument being equally divided, the judgment of the Superior Court is affirmed.
Judgment affirmed.
Order, upon petition for reargument:
Per Curiam,
And now, to wit, this 19th day of December, 1939, all of the Judges who heard this case upon consideration of it are of one mind that a reargument should be refused and the judgment of the Superior Court affirmed. The petition for reargument is therefore refused.
Reported in 133 Pa. Superior Ct. 599.
opinions.author: Per Curiam, Per Curiam,

attorneys: Jwines J. Burns, Jr., with him Gustav M. Berg and Paul M. Robinson, for appellants.
8. G. Pugliese, with him Edward Friedmwn, Andrew 8. Romito and Mwrgiotti, Pugliese, Evans & Buchley, for appellee.
casebody.head_matter:
Mazza v. Kensington Water Company et al., Appellants.
Argued March 28, 1939;
reargued October 4, 1939.
Before Kephart, O. J., Schaefer, Maxey, Linn, Stern and Barnes, JJ.
Jwines J. Burns, Jr., with him Gustav M. Berg and Paul M. Robinson, for appellants.
8. G. Pugliese, with him Edward Friedmwn, Andrew 8. Romito and Mwrgiotti, Pugliese, Evans & Buchley, for appellee.
December 4, 1939:
